results.title: Once upon a time in China II
results.creator_credit: Tsui Hark, Film Workshop and Golden Harvest
results.brief_description: Although not as bleak as the first in the series, the conflict between cultures and the rapidly changing values of the late 19th. century is the theme of this martial arts film starring asian champion Jet Lee. He clings to tradition in a China weakened by the invasion of imperialist forces while others like Sun Yat-Sen adapt to the change. There is plenty of hair-raising action and the final showdown in the Temple of the White Lotus will amaze. In Cantonese with English and Chinese subtitles.

results.title: Once upon a time in China
results.creator_credit: Tsui Hark, Film Workshop and Golden Harvest
results.brief_description: The first of one of the classic Kung Fu films starring champion Jet Lee as legendary martial arts folk hero Wong Fei Hung. Set in a time when foreign traders and Jesuit priests were beginning to enter China, Wong Fei Hung leads the Black Army, a local militia determined to protect the town against the evil forces which operate in it. An action film which will amaze and astound as Jet Lee performs a series of heroic feats, defeating any evil in his path. In Cantonese with English and Chinese subtitles.

results.title: Sex & Zen (E)
results.creator_credit: Michael Mak, Johnny Mak, Johnny Mak Production Ltd and Golden Harvest
results.brief_description: Based on the book “The Carnal prayer mat” which was banned for 400 years, this is a bawdy tale of the sexual adventures of a monk during the Ming Dynasty. Sexually explicit, this is considered to be on of China’s greatest erotic sagas. Cantonese dialogue with English subtitles. NOTE: At times the subtitles are difficult to read, this is due to the way the print has been filmed.

results.title: Naked killer
results.creator_credit: Clarence Fok Yiu, Jing Wong and Wong Jing's Workshop Ltd
results.brief_description: An amphetamine paced delight, this furiously edited Hong Kong film is about a group of killer female assassins who decide it is time to enact their revenge on the men who have obstructed their lives. The plot is largely preposterous but what is undeniable is the sheer pleasure taken by the film-makers in delivering a never-ending feast of action, spectacle, colour and martial arts fighting. Director Fok-Yiu is one of the talented South East Asian directors who have proven an influence on directors as diverse as Quentin Tarantino and Australia’s Geoffrey Wright. The film features a cold-blooded lesbian killer, Princess, who steals the show in a subversive feminist reworking of the karate “villain”. Though violent, the action is tongue-in-cheek. In Cantonese with English and Chinese subtitles.

results.title: Little Caesar
results.creator_credit: Mervyn LeRoy, Hal B. Wallis and First National Pictures
results.brief_description: ‘Little Caesar’ made Edward G.Robinson a star and exemplified the 1930’s gangster movie. Robinson plays “little tough guy” Caesar Enrico Bandello, whom with his cohort Joe Massara played by Douglas Fairbanks Jr., head for the big city in pursuit of power and wealth. His ruthlessness sees him climb to the top over his rivals, but success is short-lived in a world filled with violence and corruption. Mervyn Le Roy hired three mobsters as advisors and the film’s authenticity is a testimony to his attention to detail and fascination for the subject matter.

results.title: The Gods must be crazy
results.creator_credit: Jamie Uys and C A T Films
results.brief_description: Uys, a South African filmmaker, produced, directed and wrote this delightful, almost slapstick comedy about gentle Kalahari bushman Xi, who sets off on a trek to the ends of the earth to destroy a Coca Cola bottle which the “gods” had thrown from the sky. This ‘gift’ threatens to destroy the usual peace and happiness of the tribe. On his journey he unexpectedly collides with the modern world in the form of ruthless terrorists, a schoolteacher and a bumbling scientist studying elephant dung. ‘The Gods must be crazy’ is a comic fable which can be enjoyed by all ages.

results.title: Eraserhead
results.creator_credit: David Lynch, Lynch/Frost Productions and American Film Institute
results.brief_description: Lynch’s debut film has been re-released with a new print and stereo mix soundtrack. Opinion is divided as to film’s brilliance but over the years it has achieved cult status in it’s genre. Shot in black and white with an incredible soundtrack and tight script, ‘Eraserhead’ is the story of a timid printer Henry Spencer (John Nance) who lives in an apartment building trying to figure out what to do with his horribly mutated son. Lynch described the film as ” a dream of dark and troubling things.”
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Lynch, Lynch/Frost Productions and American Film Institute

results.title: Pink Floyd - The Wall
results.creator_credit: Gerald Scarfe, Allan Parker, Alan Marshall, Goldcrest and Tin Blue
results.brief_description: Pink Floyd’s landmark album was translated into an original rock music motion picture experience. Bob Geldof plays Pink, a burnt out rock superstar who thinks he is going mad inside a room at a Los Angeles hotel. The film takes us on a downward spiral into Pink’s hell. Live action is intercut with brilliant animation by Gerald Scarfe and the soundtrack by Pink Floyd has given this film its cult status.

results.title: A Fish called Wanda
results.creator_credit: Charles Crichton, Michael Shamberg and Prominent Features
results.brief_description: The culture clash between the English and Americans is the subject of this offbeat romantic caper, written by John Cleese and directed by veteran Charles Crichton. The “Yanks” are Wanda (Jamie Lee Curtis) and her lover/partner in crime, Otto (Kevin Kline). The “Brits” are barrister, Archie Leach (John Cleese) and Ken (Michael Palin), a stuttering animal rights activist and criminal. A diamond heist brings them together, as they all attempt to confiscate the hidden loot behind each others backs. A romantic quadrangle adds to the fun.

results.title: Wicked city (D)
results.creator_credit: Yoshiaki Kawajiri, Makoto Sedani, Kenji Karada and Manga Entertainment
results.brief_description: The treaty between humans and demons which has existed for centuries is due for renewal. The treaty is needed to prevent the world from plunging into chaos and destruction. Terrorists from both sides use the opportunity to sabotage the agreement so that they may reign supreme.
